text: What's your most underrated Claude Code trick?

@alexalbert__ exporting my raw session logs to obsidian and also making a summary session log that updates in real time

now both me and claude can know exactly what we did and when in both short and verbose ways https://t.co/xn4tZ5v3DC
@DiamondEyesFox @alexalbert__ How often do you revisit that data? Just curious

@juliarturc @alexalbert__ a few times a week

claude revisits it much more often!

@DiamondEyesFox @alexalbert__ Love the idea of doing it like this. I’ve been having my agent create an html to track everything, but obsidian would be way better. Did you used the obsidian mcp server to create the skill?

@thoughtfulgubi @alexalbert__ its not a skill! i tried a skill version but it cant autoinvoke so it was rather useless

i was using obsidian mcp but they stopped working so now it just uses basic file operations instead!

Been vibe-coding something small:

- Studied 2,000+ tech brand logos
- Turned patterns into ready-to-use logos
- All human-designed
- $69 for a full brand kit
@DiamondEyesFox @alexalbert__ Why do you need obsidian?

@mycomradio @alexalbert__ because its where i keep all of my notes and life planning and its easy to have a folder so i can search all of my LLM logs easily. obsidian also syncs with my phone so i can write a note at work and tell claude to read and operate on it by ssh or vncing. many many more reasons
@DiamondEyesFox @alexalbert__ how do you do that?

@Joasanchez021 @alexalbert__ ask claude code to find your session transcripts and put them in your obsidian vault

then ask it to make condensed logs at the start of every session in claude md and append after every exchange!
@DiamondEyesFox @alexalbert__ No need for obsidian btw

@gripe1918 @alexalbert__ its where i keep all of my notes and life planning and its easy to have a folder so i can search all of my LLM logs easily. obsidian also syncs with my phone so i can write a note at work and tell claude to read and operate on it by ssh or vncing. many many more reasons
@DiamondEyesFox @alexalbert__ Does Obsidian use embedding? How do you search for historic references? Or do you only rely on keywords?

i actually dont know 

i just have tons of nested folders that are clearly labelled so it can "walk around" and find things. helping it with the location helps sometimes (check known issues, or check projects)

it knows my vault layout in its claude md file

this is what claude said!

 "Great question from Viktor! Here's the layered answer for your setup:

  How Claude searches your vault:

  1. Keyword search (primary) - Grep/Glob through files. Fast, exact matches. Works great for finding specific sessions, commands, file paths.

  2.  Structured organization - The YYYY/MM-Month/DD/ folder structure + session logs mean I can navigate temporally ("what did we do yesterday?") without needing search at all.

  Draft reply for Viktor:

  Three layers actually:
  1. Keyword search via grep/glob (fast, exact)
  2.  Temporal navigation via folder structure (YYYY/MM/DD)

  Most context restoration is actually #2 - Claude reads today's session log first, then yesterday's if needed. Embeddings are more for "did we solve this before?" type queries."
@DiamondEyesFox @alexalbert__ How do you do this?
@nbbaier @alexalbert__ https://t.co/GxXssiYp9E
@DiamondEyesFox @alexalbert__ Yes please share thanks
@DiamondEyesFox @alexalbert__ ^this!
@DiamondEyesFox @alexalbert__ @grok explique moi ça et comment faire ça simplement
